article:
2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup

The 2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup was the eighth edition of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, a biennial international Twenty20 cricket tournament organized by the International Cricket Council (ICC). The tournament was held in Australia from October 16 to November 13, 2022.

#Background

The 2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup was originally scheduled to take place in India in 2021, but due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the ICC decided to postpone the tournament to 2022 and move it to Australia. The tournament featured 16 teams, including 12 teams that qualified directly for the Super 12 stage and four teams that competed in the First Round.

#Teams and qualifications

A total of 104 teams competed in the qualification process for the 2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup. The top 12 teams from the 2021 ICC Men's T20 World Cup qualified directly for the Super 12 stage, while the remaining teams competed in the Global Qualifiers.

##Global Qualifiers

The Global Qualifiers were held in two stages. The first stage featured 14 teams that competed in two groups of seven teams each. The top three teams from each group qualified for the second stage, where they were joined by the top two teams from the ICC Men's T20 World Cup Qualifier A and B tournaments. The top four teams from the second stage qualified for the 2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

#Match officials

The ICC appointed a team of match officials to oversee the tournament. The team consisted of 16 umpires, four match referees, and four reserve umpires.

#Squads

Each team was required to submit a squad of 15 players for the tournament. The squads were announced by the teams in the weeks leading up to the tournament.

#Venues

The tournament was held at seven venues across Australia. The venues were:

* Adelaide Oval, Adelaide
* Brisbane Cricket Ground, Brisbane
* Melbourne Cricket Ground, Melbourne
* Optus Stadium, Perth
* Sydney Cricket Ground, Sydney
* Bellerive Oval, Hobart
* Kardinia Park, Geelong

#Prize money

The total prize money for the tournament was $5.6 million. The winner received $1.6 million, while the runner-up received $800,000.

#Warm-up matches

Each team played two warm-up matches before the start of the tournament. The warm-up matches were played on October 10-13, 2022.

#First round

The First Round featured four teams that competed in two groups of two teams each. The teams were:

* Group A: Sri Lanka, Namibia, Netherlands, UAE
* Group B: West Indies, Scotland, Zimbabwe, Ireland

##Group A

The Group A matches were played on October 16-20, 2022. Sri Lanka and Netherlands qualified for the Super 12 stage.

##Group B

The Group B matches were played on October 17-21, 2022. West Indies and Scotland qualified for the Super 12 stage.

#Super 12

The Super 12 stage featured 12 teams that competed in two groups of six teams each. The teams were:

* Group 1: Australia, Afghanistan, England, New Zealand, Sri Lanka, Ireland
* Group 2: India, Pakistan, South Africa, Bangladesh, Netherlands, Zimbabwe

##Group 1

The Group 1 matches were played on October 22-November 4, 2022. New Zealand and England qualified for the semi-finals.

##Group 2

The Group 2 matches were played on October 23-November 6, 2022. India and Pakistan qualified for the semi-finals.

#Knockout stage

The knockout stage featured the top two teams from each group in the Super 12 stage.

##Semi-finals

The semi-finals were played on November 9-10, 2022. Pakistan defeated New Zealand, while England defeated India.

##Final

The final was played on November 13, 2022, at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. England defeated Pakistan to win the tournament.

#Statistics

##Most runs

The top five run-scorers in the tournament were:

* Virat Kohli (India) - 296 runs
* Jos Buttler (England) - 269 runs
* Suryakumar Yadav (India) - 268 runs
* Kusal Mendis (Sri Lanka) - 257 runs
* Glenn Phillips (New Zealand) - 242 runs

##Most wickets

The top five wicket-takers in the tournament were:

* Wanindu Hasaranga (Sri Lanka) - 15 wickets
* Adil Rashid (England) - 12 wickets
* Mark Wood (England) - 12 wickets
* Shadab Khan (Pakistan) - 11 wickets
* Anrich Nortje (South Africa) - 11 wickets

#Team of the tournament

The ICC announced the team of the tournament, which consisted of 11 players. The team was:

* Jos Buttler (England) - captain
* Virat Kohli (India)
* Suryakumar Yadav (India)
* Glenn Phillips (New Zealand)
* Kusal Mendis (Sri Lanka)
* Sikandar Raza (Zimbabwe)
* Sam Curran (England)
* Wanindu Hasaranga (Sri Lanka)
* Mark Wood (England)
* Adil Rashid (England)
* Shadab Khan (Pakistan)

#Notes

The 2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup was the first ICC tournament to be held in Australia since the 2015 ICC Cricket World Cup.

article:
Chapel-le-Dale (valley)

Chapel-le-Dale is a scenic valley located in the Yorkshire Dales National Park, North Yorkshire, England. The valley is approximately 10 miles (16 km) long and 1 mile (1.6 km) wide, stretching from the village of Chapel-le-Dale in the north to the village of Ingleton in the south. The valley is known for its picturesque landscape, rich history, and diverse wildlife.

# History

The history of Chapel-le-Dale dates back to the Mesolithic period, with evidence of human habitation found in the form of flint tools and other artifacts. The valley was later settled by the Romans, who built a road through the valley to connect the Roman fort of Virosidum ( Bainbridge) to the Roman town of Olicana (Ilkley).

## River names

The valley is drained by the River Doe, which flows through the valley and joins the River Twiss at the southern end of the valley. The River Doe is also known as the "Doe Beck" in some parts of the valley. The name "Doe" is thought to be derived from the Old English word "dō", which means "dark" or " gloomy".

## Etymology

The name "Chapel-le-Dale" is thought to be derived from the Old English words "cēpel", meaning "chapel" and "dæl", meaning "valley". The name likely refers to a chapel that was built in the valley during the medieval period.

# Geology and geomorphology

The valley is situated in the Pennines, a mountain range that runs through northern England. The geology of the valley is characterized by limestone and dolomite rocks, which date back to the Carboniferous period. The rocks in the valley have been shaped by millions of years of weathering and erosion, resulting in the formation of scenic valleys, hills, and caves.

## Quarrying and mining

The valley has a long history of quarrying and mining, with limestone and dolomite rocks being extracted for use in construction and other industries. The quarrying and mining activities in the valley have resulted in the formation of spoil heaps and other industrial features that are now part of the valley's landscape.

# Climate

The climate in Chapel-le-Dale is characterized by cool winters and mild summers. The valley is situated in a region of high rainfall, with an average annual rainfall of over 1,000 mm (39 in). The climate in the valley is influenced by its proximity to the Pennines, which creates a rain shadow effect that results in a drier climate to the east of the valley.

# Settlements and governance

The valley is home to several villages and hamlets, including Chapel-le-Dale, Ingleton, and Twistleton. The valley is governed by the Yorkshire Dales National Park Authority, which is responsible for managing the natural and cultural resources of the valley. The valley is also part of the Craven district of North Yorkshire, which provides local government services such as education, healthcare, and waste management.

# Tourist attractions

Chapel-le-Dale is a popular tourist destination, with visitors drawn to the valley's scenic landscape, rich history, and diverse wildlife. The valley is home to several tourist attractions, including the Chapel-le-Dale Church, the Ingleton Waterfalls Trail, and the Twistleton Scars.

# Wildlife and designations

The valley is home to a diverse range of wildlife, including birds, mammals, and insects. The valley is a designated Site of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI) and a Special Area of Conservation (SAC), which recognizes its importance for nature conservation. The valley is also home to several Scheduled Ancient Monuments, which recognize its importance for cultural heritage.

# Notable people

Chapel-le-Dale has been home to several notable people, including the poet and writer, Alfred Wainwright, who lived in the valley for many years. Wainwright is best known for his Pictorial Guides to the Lakeland Fells, which are a series of books that describe the hills and mountains of the Lake District National Park.

# Notes

This article uses the place name "Chapel-le-Dale" to refer to the valley, rather than the village of Chapel-le-Dale, which is situated at the northern end of the valley.

# References

No references are provided, as this article is a general overview of the valley and its features.

## Sources

No sources are provided, as this article is a general overview of the valley and its features.

# External links

No external links are provided, as this article is a self-contained overview of the valley and its features.

article:
2022 Pakistan Super League

The 2022 Pakistan Super League (PSL 7 or for sponsorship reasons HBL PSL 2022) was the seventh season of the Pakistan Super League, a professional Twenty20 cricket league established by the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) in 2015. The tournament was held from 27 January to 27 February 2022.

#Squads

Each team was allowed to retain a maximum of eight players from their previous season's squad. The draft for the 2022 season was held on 12 December 2021 in Lahore. The teams were allowed to pick a maximum of three platinum, three diamond, three gold, five silver, two emerging, and two supplementary players.

Islamabad United retained Shadab Khan, Asif Ali, and Faheem Ashraf, while Quetta Gladiators retained Sarfaraz Ahmed, Mohammad Nawaz, and Mohammad Hasnain. Karachi Kings retained Babar Azam, Imad Wasim, and Mohammad Amir, while Lahore Qalandars retained Rashid Khan, Shaheen Afridi, and Haris Rauf. Multan Sultans retained Mohammad Rizwan, Rilee Rossouw, and Sohaib Maqsood, while Peshawar Zalmi retained Wahab Riaz, Shoaib Malik, and Haider Ali.

#Venues

The tournament was played at two venues: National Stadium in Karachi and Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore. National Stadium hosted 15 matches, including the first 15 matches of the league stage, while Gaddafi Stadium hosted 19 matches, including the remaining 15 matches of the league stage and all the playoff matches.

#COVID-19 protocols

The PCB implemented strict COVID-19 protocols for the tournament. All players, officials, and support staff were required to undergo PCR tests before entering the bio-secure bubble. The players were also required to wear masks and maintain social distancing during the matches.

#Match officials

##Umpires

The PCB appointed a panel of umpires for the tournament. The umpires included Aleem Dar, Ahsan Raza, Asif Yaqoob, Faisal Afridi, Imran Jawed, and Rashid Riaz.

##Referees

The PCB appointed a panel of referees for the tournament. The referees included Ali Naqvi, Iftikhar Ahmed, and Roshan Mahanama.

#Marketing

##Broadcast rights

The broadcast rights for the tournament were acquired by PTV Sports, Geo Super, and BSports. The tournament was also streamed live on the PCB's YouTube channel.

##Anthem and curtain raiser

The official anthem for the tournament was "Agay Dekh" by Atif Aslam and Aima Baig. The curtain raiser was performed by Atif Aslam, Aima Baig, and a dance troupe.

##Media personnel

The PCB accredited a number of media personnel for the tournament. The media personnel included journalists, photographers, and camera crew.

##Curtain closer

The curtain closer was performed by Strings and a dance troupe.

#League stage

##Format

The league stage of the tournament was played on a double round-robin format, where each team played the other five teams twice. The top four teams qualified for the playoffs.

##Points table

The points table was topped by Multan Sultans, who won nine matches and lost one. They were followed by Lahore Qalandars, who won six matches and lost four.

article:
2022–23 NHL Transactions

The 2022–23 NHL season was the 106th season of operation for the National Hockey League (NHL). This article outlines the major transactions that took place during the 2022–23 season, including player retirements, contract terminations, free agency signings, trades, and waiver claims.

#Retirement

Several players announced their retirement from professional hockey during the 2022–23 season. These players include:

* Zdeno Chára, a defenseman who played 24 seasons in the NHL, including stints with the Ottawa Senators, Boston Bruins, and New York Islanders.
* Ryan Miller, a goaltender who played 18 seasons in the NHL, including stints with the Buffalo Sabres, St. Louis Blues, and Anaheim Ducks.
* Joe Thornton, a center who played 24 seasons in the NHL, including stints with the Boston Bruins, San Jose Sharks, and Toronto Maple Leafs.

#Contract Terminations

Several players had their contracts terminated by their respective teams during the 2022–23 season. These players include:

* Justin Abdelkader, a left wing who had his contract terminated by the Detroit Red Wings.
* Michael Haley, a center who had his contract terminated by the New York Islanders.

article:
Nagpuria people

The Nagpuria people are an ethnolinguistic group native to the Nagpur region in the eastern part of India. They are predominantly found in the state of Jharkhand and adjacent areas of Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, and West Bengal. The Nagpuria people have a distinct culture, language, and history that dates back to prehistoric times.

# Names

The term "Nagpuria" is derived from the name of the city of Nagpur, which was the capital of the Nagpur kingdom in the medieval period. The people of this region were known as "Nagpuria" or "Nagpuri" in the local language. Over time, the term "Nagpuria" has come to be used to refer to the entire ethnolinguistic group that inhabits this region.

# History

## Prehistoric era

The Nagpur region has been inhabited since prehistoric times. Archaeological evidence suggests that the region was inhabited by various tribes and groups during the Stone Age. The discovery of tools and artifacts from the Paleolithic and Neolithic periods indicates that human habitation in the region dates back to at least 10,000 years.

## Ancient period

The Nagpur region was part of the ancient Mauryan Empire, which was founded by Chandragupta Maurya in the 3rd century BCE. The region was also part of the Gupta Empire, which was founded by Sri Gupta in the 3rd century CE. During this period, the region was an important center of trade and commerce.

## Medieval period

In the medieval period, the Nagpur region was ruled by various dynasties, including the Nagvanshi and the Chero. The Nagvanshi dynasty was founded by Raja Phani Mukut Rai in the 12th century CE, and it ruled the region for over 500 years. The Chero dynasty was founded by Raja Bhubaneswar in the 15th century CE, and it ruled the region for over 200 years.

## Modern period

In the modern period, the Nagpur region was part of the British Empire. The British East India Company established its rule in the region in the 18th century CE, and it remained under British rule until India gained independence in 1947.

## Post Independence

After India gained independence, the Nagpur region became part of the state of Bihar. In 2000, the state of Jharkhand was created, and the Nagpur region became part of this new state.

# Communities

## Lineages

The Nagpuria people are divided into several lineages, including the Nagvanshi, Chero, and Khangar. Each lineage has its own distinct culture and traditions.

# Culture

## Language and literature

The Nagpuria people speak the Nagpuri language, which is a member of the Indo-Aryan language family. The language has its own distinct script and literature. The Nagpuri language is spoken by over 5 million people in India and abroad.

## Festivals

The Nagpuria people celebrate several festivals throughout the year, including the Sarhul festival, which is celebrated in the month of March. The festival is dedicated to the worship of the goddess Sarhul, who is the patron deity of the Nagpuria people.

## Folk music and dance

The Nagpuria people have a rich tradition of folk music and dance. The Jhumar dance is a popular folk dance that is performed during festivals and celebrations.

## Clothes

The Nagpuria people wear traditional clothes, including the dhoti and kurta for men, and the saree and blouse for women. The clothes are made from cotton and silk fabrics.

## Marriage tradition

The Nagpuria people have a unique marriage tradition. The marriage ceremony is known as the "Sarhul" ceremony, and it is performed during the Sarhul festival.

## Religion

The Nagpuria people are predominantly Hindu, but there are also significant numbers of Christians and Muslims in the community. The Nagpuria people worship a range of deities, including the goddess Sarhul and the god Shiva.

# Notable people

Several notable people have emerged from the Nagpuria community, including politicians, writers, and artists. Some notable Nagpuria people include:

* Raja Phani Mukut Rai, the founder of the Nagvanshi dynasty
* Raja Bhubaneswar, the founder of the Chero dynasty
* Sri Aurobindo, a philosopher and writer who was born in the Nagpur region
* Ramdhari Singh Dinkar, a poet and writer who was born in the Nagpur region

article:
2023 United States Banking Crisis

The 2023 United States banking crisis refers to a series of bank failures and government interventions that occurred in the United States in 2023. The crisis was triggered by a combination of factors, including high interest rates, rapid inflation, and a decline in the value of government securities held by banks. The crisis resulted in the collapse of several major banks, including Silvergate Bank, Silicon Valley Bank, Signature Bank, and First Republic Bank.

# Background

The 2023 United States banking crisis was preceded by a period of rapid economic growth and low interest rates. In 2021 and 2022, the Federal Reserve, the central bank of the United States, kept interest rates low to stimulate economic growth. However, as the economy grew and inflation began to rise, the Federal Reserve started to raise interest rates to combat inflation. This increase in interest rates led to a decline in the value of government securities held by banks, which in turn reduced the capital of these banks.

In addition, many banks had invested heavily in long-term government securities, which had lower yields than shorter-term securities. As interest rates rose, the value of these long-term securities declined, reducing the capital of these banks. Furthermore, many banks had also invested in other assets, such as cryptocurrency and tech stocks, which were also declining in value.

# Liquidation of Silvergate Bank

## Background

Silvergate Bank was a California-based bank that specialized in providing banking services to cryptocurrency companies. The bank had grown rapidly in the preceding years, with its assets increasing from $1.9 billion in 2020 to $11.9 billion in 2022. However, the bank's rapid growth and heavy investment in cryptocurrency-related assets made it vulnerable to a decline in the value of these assets.

## Events

On March 8, 2023, Silvergate Bank announced that it would be winding down its operations and liquidating its assets. The bank's decision was triggered by a decline in the value of its assets, particularly its cryptocurrency-related assets, which had fallen in value due to a decline in the price of cryptocurrencies. The bank's liquidation was overseen by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC), which insured the bank's deposits.

# Collapse of Silicon Valley Bank

## Background

Silicon Valley Bank was a California-based bank that specialized in providing banking services to tech companies. The bank had grown rapidly in the preceding years, with its assets increasing from $71 billion in 2020 to $209 billion in 2022. However, the bank's rapid growth and heavy investment in long-term government securities made it vulnerable to a decline in the value of these securities.

## Events

On March 10, 2023, Silicon Valley Bank was closed by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation, and the FDIC was appointed as the bank's receiver. The bank's closure was triggered by a decline in the value of its assets, particularly its long-term government securities, which had fallen in value due to a rise in interest rates. The bank's failure was the largest bank failure in the United States since the 2008 financial crisis.

# Collapse of Signature Bank

## Background

Signature Bank was a New York-based bank that specialized in providing banking services to crypto companies. The bank had grown rapidly in the preceding years, with its assets increasing from $50 billion in 2020 to $110 billion in 2022. However, the bank's rapid growth and heavy investment in cryptocurrency-related assets made it vulnerable to a decline in the value of these assets.

## Events

On March 12, 2023, Signature Bank was closed by the New York State Department of Financial Services, and the FDIC was appointed as the bank's receiver. The bank's closure was triggered by a decline in the value of its assets, particularly its cryptocurrency-related assets, which had fallen in value due to a decline in the price of cryptocurrencies.

# Collapse of First Republic Bank

## Background

First Republic Bank was a California-based bank that specialized in providing banking services to wealthy individuals and companies. The bank had grown rapidly in the preceding years, with its assets increasing from $120 billion in 2020 to $230 billion in 2022. However, the bank's rapid growth and heavy investment in long-term government securities made it vulnerable to a decline in the value of these securities.

## Events

On May 1, 2023, First Republic Bank was sold to JPMorgan Chase, one of the largest banks in the United States. The sale was triggered by a decline in the value of the bank's assets, particularly its long-term government securities, which had fallen in value due to a rise in interest rates. The sale was overseen by the FDIC, which insured the bank's deposits.

# Aftermath

## Bank Term Funding Program

In response to the banking crisis, the Federal Reserve announced the creation of the Bank Term Funding Program (BTFP), a program that would provide loans to banks for up to one year. The program was designed to provide liquidity to banks and prevent further bank failures.

## Government discussion of other funding

In addition to the BTFP, the US government discussed other funding options to support the banking system. These options included a potential bailout of the banking system, as well as the creation of a new agency to oversee the banking system.

## U.S. investigations

The US government launched investigations into the causes of the banking crisis, including the role of regulators and the impact of interest rate hikes.

## Economic impact

The banking crisis had a significant impact on the US economy, with the S&P 500 falling by over 10% in the aftermath of the crisis. The crisis also led to a decline in consumer confidence and a slowdown in economic growth.

## International impact

The banking crisis also had an impact on the global economy, with stock markets falling around the world. The crisis also led to a decline in international trade and a slowdown in global economic growth.

Amritpal Singh
================

Amritpal Singh is an Indian Sikh activist and politician. He is the leader of the organization Waris Punjab De, a Sikh advocacy group that seeks to promote Sikhism and address social issues affecting the Sikh community. Singh has been at the center of controversy due to his activism, styling himself after the Sikh separatist leader Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale, and his involvement in violent clashes with the police.

Early life
-----------

Amritpal Singh was born in 1993 in Jallupur Khera village, Amritsar, Punjab, India. Little is known about his early life, but it is reported that he was raised in a traditional Sikh family and was educated in a local school. Singh's family has stated that he was drawn to Sikh activism from an early age and was influenced by the teachings of Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale, a prominent Sikh separatist leader who was killed in Operation Blue Star in 1984.

Waris Punjab De
----------------

### Succession to Deep Sidhu

In 2022, Amritpal Singh took over as the leader of Waris Punjab De, a Sikh advocacy group founded by Deep Sidhu, a Punjabi actor and activist who died in a car accident in February 2022. Sidhu had been a prominent figure in the Sikh separatist movement, and Singh's succession was seen as a continuation of his legacy.

### Campaigning and Prachaar

Singh has been actively involved in campaigning and prachaar (preaching) across Punjab, promoting Sikhism and addressing social issues affecting the Sikh community. He has been known to deliver fiery speeches, often criticizing the Indian government and advocating for Sikh rights.

### Drug rehabilitation

Waris Punjab De has also been involved in drug rehabilitation efforts, with Singh claiming that the organization has helped thousands of young people overcome addiction. However, critics have questioned the efficacy of these efforts and accused Singh of using them as a recruitment tool for his organization.

### Early controversies

Singh's leadership of Waris Punjab De has been marked by controversy, with critics accusing him of promoting extremist views and inciting violence. In 2022, he was involved in a clash with the police in Amritsar, which led to his arrest and subsequent release on bail.

### Khalistan and Bhindranwale styling

Singh has been accused of promoting the idea of Khalistan, a proposed Sikh homeland, and has been styling himself after Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale. He has been seen wearing clothing and accessories similar to those worn by Bhindranwale, and has been known to quote his speeches and writings.

Political career
-----------------

### Member of Parliament

In 2022, Singh announced his intention to contest the Indian general election as a candidate for the Shiromani Akali Dal (Mann) party. However, he was not selected as a candidate, and the party ultimately did not win any seats in the election.

Participation in violence
-------------------------

### Ajnala clash

In February 2023, Singh was involved in a violent clash with the police in Ajnala, Punjab, which left several people injured. The clash was sparked by a protest against the arrest of a Waris Punjab De member, and Singh was accused of inciting the violence.

Crackdown and arrest
---------------------

### Allegations and charges

In March 2023, the Indian government launched a crackdown on Waris Punjab De, arresting several of its members, including Singh. He was accused of promoting extremism, inciting violence, and conspiring against the state.

### Reactions

#### Domestic

The crackdown on Waris Punjab De and the arrest of Singh were widely condemned by opposition parties and human rights groups in India. Critics accused the government of suppressing dissent and targeting Sikh activists.

#### International

The international community also reacted to Singh's arrest, with several countries and organizations expressing concern about the human rights situation in India. The United States, the United Kingdom, and Canada all issued statements calling for the Indian government to respect human rights and allow peaceful protest.

-------------

Little is known about Singh's personal life, but it is reported that he is unmarried and lives with his family in Amritsar. He is known to be a devout Sikh and follows a strict code of conduct.

article:
Survivor Greece Season 10

Survivor Greece Season 10 was the tenth season of the Greek reality television series Survivor. The season premiered on September 13, 2020, and concluded on December 20, 2020. The show was hosted by Giorgos Lianos and broadcast on Skai TV.

# Contestants

The season featured 24 contestants, divided into two tribes: the blue tribe, known as "Galazioi" (Γαλάζιοι), and the red tribe, known as "Kokkinoi" (Κόκκινοι). The contestants were from various backgrounds and ages, including celebrities, athletes, and ordinary citizens.

The contestants were:

* Galazioi (Blue Tribe):
	+ Andreas Anastasiou
	+ Eleni Vlachopoulou
	+ Giorgos Savvidis
	+ Kostas Papadopoulos
	+ Maria Androutsou
	+ Marianna Tzobanaki
	+ Michalis Mouroutsos
	+ Nikos Antoniou
	+ Panagiotis "Panos" Christodoulou
	+ Sophia Hadjipanteli
	+ Vasiliki "Vicky" Kourkoulou
* Kokkinoi (Red Tribe):
	+ Alexandra "Alex" Kavallierou
	+ Anastasios "Tasos" Christodoulou
	+ Dimitris "Dimitris" Kourkoulos
	+ Eleni Foureira
	+ Giorgos "Giorgos" Tzortzakis
	+ Ioanna "Joanna" Nikolaidou
	+ Konstantinos "Kostas" Mavroudis
	+ Konstantinos "Kostas" Papageorgiou
	+ Maria "Maria" Sideri
	+ Nikolaos "Nikos" Gavalas
	+ Sophia "Sophia" Kavoura

# Voting History

## Nominations Table

| 4 | Kostas Papadopoulos, Vicky Kourkoulou | Dimitris Kourkoulos, Kostas Papageorgiou | Kostas Papadopoulos |

| 6 | Michalis Mouroutsos, Nikos Antoniou | Ioanna Nikolaidou, Kostas Mavroudis | Michalis Mouroutsos |
| 7 | Panos Christodoulou, Sophia Hadjipanteli | Alexandra Kavallierou, Tasos Christodoulou | Panos Christodoulou |
| 8 | Vicky Kourkoulou, Nikos Antoniou | Dimitris Kourkoulos, Kostas Papageorgiou | Vicky Kourkoulou |

| 10 | Nikos Antoniou, Giorgos Tzortzakis | Ioanna Nikolaidou, Kostas Mavroudis | Nikos Antoniou |

# Matches

## Team Matches

The season featured various team matches, including challenges and games. The tribes competed against each other to win rewards and immunity from elimination.

Some notable team matches included:

* Week 1: Galazioi won the first team match, a challenge that involved building a raft and sailing to a nearby island.
* Week 3: Kokkinoi won a challenge that involved collecting puzzle pieces and solving a puzzle.
* Week 5: Galazioi won a challenge that involved building a bridge and crossing it.
* Week 7: Kokkinoi won a challenge that involved collecting flags and bringing them back to their tribe's base.

# Finals

The final episode of the season featured the last three contestants: Eleni Foureira, Giorgos Tzortzakis, and Ioanna Nikolaidou. The contestants competed in a series of challenges and games to win the title of Sole Survivor.

In the end, Eleni Foureira was crowned the winner of Survivor Greece Season 10, taking home the grand prize of €100,000.

# Ratings

Survivor Greece Season 10 was a ratings success, with the season premiere attracting over 1.5 million viewers. The season averaged around 1.2 million viewers per episode, making it one of the most-watched shows on Greek television.

The season finale was watched by over 2 million viewers, making it one of the most-watched television episodes in Greek history.

article:
Kantara (film)

Kantara is a 2022 Indian Kannada-language action drama film written and directed by Rishab Shetty, and produced by Vijay Kiragandur under the banner of Hombale Films. The film stars Rishab Shetty, Kishore Kumar G, Achyuth Kumar, and Sapthami Gowda in lead roles. Kantara is set in a small village in Karnataka and explores the themes of land ownership, power struggles, and the clash between tradition and modernity.

#Plot

The film is set in a remote village in Karnataka, where a small community lives in harmony with nature. The story revolves around Shiva, a young man who lives in the village and is deeply rooted in its traditions. However, when a forest officer, Murali, arrives in the village, Shiva finds himself at odds with him over issues of land ownership and conservation. As tensions rise, Shiva must navigate the complexities of power struggles and corruption to protect his community's way of life.

Meanwhile, a wealthy businessman, Devendra, seeks to acquire the village land for his own interests, further exacerbating the conflict. Shiva must confront his own demons and make difficult choices to ensure the survival of his community. Along the way, he discovers the true meaning of courage, sacrifice, and the importance of preserving traditional values.

#Cast

* Rishab Shetty as Shiva
* Kishore Kumar G as Murali
* Achyuth Kumar as Devendra
* Sapthami Gowda as Leela
* Pramod Shetty as Guruva
* Vinay Bidappa as Rajeeva
* Nishant as Sudhakar

#Production

##Development

Kantara was conceived by Rishab Shetty, who drew inspiration from his own experiences growing up in a small village in Karnataka. Shetty spent several years researching and developing the script, drawing from real-life events and incorporating elements of mythology and folklore. The film's title, Kantara, refers to a sacred forest in Hindu mythology, reflecting the film's themes of nature, tradition, and spirituality.

##Filming

Principal photography for Kantara began in August 2021 and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in various parts of Karnataka, including the Western Ghats and the coastal regions. The crew faced numerous challenges during filming, including navigating treacherous terrain and dealing with unpredictable weather conditions. Despite these challenges, the team persevered, driven by their passion for the project.

#Music

The music for Kantara was composed by B. Ajaneesh Loknath, who incorporated traditional Kannada folk music elements into the score. The soundtrack features several catchy and emotive tracks, including the hit single "Soul of Kantara". The music played a crucial role in setting the tone and atmosphere of the film, and received widespread critical acclaim.

#Release

Kantara was released in theaters on September 30, 2022, to positive reviews and strong box office performance. The film was initially released in Kannada, but later dubbed into other languages, including Telugu and Hindi.

##Home media

Kantara was released on digital platforms, including Amazon Prime Video, on November 24, 2022. The film was also released on DVD and Blu-ray discs, allowing fans to own a physical copy of the movie.

#Reception

##Box office

Kantara performed well at the box office, grossing over ₹100 crore worldwide. The film's success can be attributed to its strong word-of-mouth and positive reviews from critics and audiences alike.

###Telugu version

The Telugu version of Kantara, titled Kantara (Telugu), was released on October 15, 2022. The film performed well in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, grossing over ₹20 crore in its opening week.

###Hindi version

The Hindi version of Kantara, titled Kantara (Hindi), was released on October 22, 2022. The film performed moderately well in northern India, grossing over ₹10 crore in its opening week.

##Critical reception

Kantara received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's storytelling, direction, and performances. The film holds a rating of 8.1/10 on IMDB, based on over 50,000 user reviews.

#Impact

Kantara has had a significant impact on Kannada cinema, paving the way for more rural-based dramas and inspiring a new generation of filmmakers. The film's success has also led to increased recognition and appreciation for Kannada culture and traditions.

#Prequel

A prequel to Kantara, titled Kantara: Chapter 2, has been announced, with Rishab Shetty set to reprise his role as Shiva. The prequel is expected to explore the backstory of Shiva and the village, delving deeper into the themes of tradition and modernity.

#Controversies

Kantara has been involved in several controversies, including allegations of plagiarism and cultural appropriation. However, the film's makers have denied these allegations, stating that the film is an original work inspired by real-life events and Kannada folklore.

#Notes

* Kantara is the highest-grossing Kannada film of 2022.
* The film's success has led to increased investment in Kannada cinema, with several new productions announced in 2022.
* Kantara has been selected for several international film festivals, including the Toronto International Film Festival.

article:
2023 Under-19 Women's T20 World Cup

The 2023 Under-19 Women's T20 World Cup was the inaugural edition of the Under-19 Women's T20 World Cup, an international women's cricket tournament contested by the under-19 national teams of the member associations of the International Cricket Council (ICC). The tournament was held in South Africa from 14 to 29 January 2023.

#Background

The ICC announced the inaugural edition of the Under-19 Women's T20 World Cup in November 2021, with the tournament scheduled to take place in 2023. The event was seen as a crucial step in the development of women's cricket, providing a platform for young players to gain international experience and exposure. The tournament was also expected to boost the growth of women's cricket globally, following the success of the ICC Women's T20 World Cup and the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup.

#Qualification

A total of 16 teams qualified for the tournament, with the top three teams from each of the five regional qualification groups earning a spot in the main event. The qualification process was held from 2021 to 2022, with teams competing in regional tournaments to secure their place in the World Cup. The teams that qualified for the tournament were:

* Africa: South Africa, Rwanda, and Zimbabwe
* Asia: India, Sri Lanka, and United Arab Emirates
* East Asia-Pacific: Australia and Papua New Guinea
* Europe: England, Ireland, and Scotland
* Americas: United States and West Indies

#Competition format

The tournament featured a round-robin group stage, followed by a Super 6 stage, and culminating in the knockout stage. The 16 teams were divided into four groups of four teams each, with the top three teams from each group advancing to the Super 6 stage. The Super 6 stage consisted of two groups of six teams each, with the top two teams from each group advancing to the knockout stage.

#Squads

Each team was allowed to select a squad of 15 players, with a minimum of 11 players required for each match. The squads were announced by the respective teams prior to the tournament, with a number of teams selecting experienced players who had previously represented their countries at the senior level.

#Match officials

article:
Jurassic World Dominion

Jurassic World Dominion is a 2022 American science fiction adventure film directed by Colin Trevorrow, who also co-wrote the screenplay with Emily Carmichael. The film is the third installment in the Jurassic World trilogy and the sixth overall in the Jurassic Park franchise. It stars Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum, and Sam Neill, reprising their roles from previous films in the franchise.

#Plot

The film takes place four years after the events of Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom. Dinosaurs and humans are now coexisting on the planet, with the former having spread across the globe. Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard) are trying to protect a young Velociraptor named Beta, who is the clone of the original Indominus Rex. Meanwhile, a new threat emerges in the form of giant genetically modified locusts that are destroying crops worldwide.

As the story unfolds, Owen and Claire join forces with Alan Grant (Sam Neill), Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern), and Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum) to take down the sinister biotech company, Biosyn, which is behind the creation of the locusts. Along the way, they must navigate the dangers of a world where dinosaurs and humans are struggling to coexist.

#Cast

* Chris Pratt as Owen Grady
* Bryce Dallas Howard as Claire Dearing
* Laura Dern as Dr. Ellie Sattler
* Jeff Goldblum as Dr. Ian Malcolm
* Sam Neill as Dr. Alan Grant
* DeWanda Wise as Kayla Watts
* Mamoudou Athie as Ramsay Cole
* Isabella Sermon as Maisie Lockwood
* Campbell Scott as Dr. Lewis Dodgson
* BD Wong as Dr. Henry Wu

#Production

##Development

The development of Jurassic World Dominion began in 2018, with Colin Trevorrow announcing that he would be returning to direct the film. Trevorrow had previously directed the first Jurassic World film and had written the screenplay for the second installment, Fallen Kingdom. The film's production was set to begin in 2020, but it was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

##Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in 2019, with Trevorrow and his co-writer, Emily Carmichael, working on the screenplay. The film's producers, Frank Marshall and Pat Crowley, also began scouting locations for the film.

##Writing

Trevorrow and Carmichael's screenplay for Jurassic World Dominion was influenced by the events of the previous films in the franchise. They wanted to create a story that would bring together the characters from the original Jurassic Park trilogy and the new characters introduced in the Jurassic World films. The screenplay also explored the themes of coexistence and the dangers of playing with nature.

##Casting

The cast of Jurassic World Dominion includes returning stars Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum, and Sam Neill. New cast members include DeWanda Wise, Mamoudou Athie, and Campbell Scott.

##Filming

###COVID-19 pandemic

Filming on Jurassic World Dominion was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The film's production team had to implement strict safety protocols to protect the cast and crew from the virus.

###Locations and sets

The film was shot on location in the United Kingdom, Malta, and Italy. The production team also built sets at Pinewood Studios in the UK.

##Creatures on screen

The film features a wide range of dinosaurs and other creatures, including the Velociraptor, Tyrannosaurus Rex, and Triceratops. The creatures were brought to life using a combination of practical and visual effects.

##Post-production

Post-production on the film began in 2021, with Trevorrow working with his editor, Mark Sanger, to assemble the final cut of the film. The visual effects team, led by David Vickery, worked to create the film's impressive dinosaur sequences.

#Music

The score for Jurassic World Dominion was composed by Michael Giacchino, who has worked on all three films in the Jurassic World trilogy. Giacchino's score incorporates themes from the original Jurassic Park trilogy, as well as new material.

#Marketing

The marketing campaign for Jurassic World Dominion began in 2021, with the release of the film's first trailer. The trailer featured footage of the film's dinosaurs and action sequences, as well as a glimpse of the new villain, Biosyn.

#Release

##Theaters

Jurassic World Dominion was released in theaters worldwide on June 10, 2022.

##Home media

The film was released on digital platforms in August 2022, followed by a Blu-ray and DVD release in September.

#Reception

##Box office

Jurassic World Dominion was a commercial success, grossing over $1 billion at the global box office.

##Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising its action sequences and visual effects, while others criticized its storyline and characters.

##Accolades

The film was nominated for several awards, including the Visual Effects Society Awards and the Critics' Choice Movie Awards.

#Future

Jurassic World Dominion is the final installment in the Jurassic World trilogy, but it is not the end of the Jurassic Park franchise. A new film, titled Jurassic World: The Next Chapter, is currently in development, with Trevorrow set to direct.

This article is a comprehensive overview of the 2022 film, Jurassic World Dominion. It covers the film's production, plot, cast, and reception, as well as its place in the larger Jurassic Park franchise.

Ice Hockey at the 2022 Winter Olympics – Men's Tournament

The men's ice hockey tournament at the 2022 Winter Olympics was the 25th edition of the men's ice hockey competition at the Winter Olympics. It was held at the Beijing National Indoor Stadium and the Wukesong Arena in Beijing, China, from February 9 to February 20, 2022.

# Venues

The tournament was held at two venues in Beijing, China:

* Beijing National Indoor Stadium: This was the main venue for the tournament, hosting the majority of the games, including the medal matches.
* Wukesong Arena: This venue hosted some of the preliminary round and playoff round games.

Both venues have a seating capacity of over 18,000, providing an electric atmosphere for the players and spectators.

# Qualified Teams

Twelve teams qualified for the men's ice hockey tournament at the 2022 Winter Olympics:

*  Canada: Defending champions and one of the most successful teams in the tournament's history.
*  China: As the host nation, China was automatically qualified for the tournament.
*  Czech Republic: A consistent top-tier team in international competitions.
*  Denmark: Qualified for their third consecutive Olympic tournament.
*  Finland: A perennial contender for the medals, with a rich hockey tradition.
*  Germany: Qualified for their 20th Olympic tournament, seeking to improve on their previous performances.
*  Great Britain: Returned to the Olympic stage after a 74-year absence.
*  Latvia: Qualified for their sixth consecutive Olympic tournament.
*  Norway: Made their third consecutive Olympic appearance.
*  ROC: Competing under the Olympic flag due to a doping ban, the ROC team was one of the favorites to win the tournament.
*  Slovakia: Qualified for their seventh consecutive Olympic tournament.
*  Sweden: A consistent top-tier team, seeking to improve on their previous Olympic performances.
*  Switzerland: Qualified for their 13th consecutive Olympic tournament.
*  United States: A traditional powerhouse in international hockey, seeking to regain their Olympic title.

# Format

The tournament consisted of two stages: the preliminary round and the playoff round.

* Preliminary Round: The 12 teams were divided into three groups of four teams each. Each team played the other teams in their group once, with the top two teams from each group advancing to the playoff round.
* Playoff Round: The eight teams that advanced from the preliminary round played in a single-elimination bracket, with the quarterfinals, semifinals, and medal matches determining the final standings.

# Rosters

Each team was allowed to have a roster of 25 players, with a minimum of 15 skaters and three goaltenders. Teams were required to submit their final rosters on February 8, 2022.

## NHL Participation

The National Hockey League (NHL) did not participate in the 2022 Winter Olympics, due to a scheduling conflict with the league's regular season. However, many NHL players were released by their teams to participate in the tournament, and several teams had a significant number of NHL players on their rosters.

# Match Officials

# Preliminary Round

The preliminary round was played from February 9 to February 13, 2022.

## Tiebreak Criteria

article:
Gheorghe Pintilie

Gheorghe Pintilie was a Romanian communist politician who served as the first chief of the General Directorate for the Security of the People (DGSP), the secret police of the Socialist Republic of Romania. Pintilie played a significant role in the establishment of the communist regime in Romania and was instrumental in implementing the country's repressive policies.

#Biography

##Youth and imprisonment

Gheorghe Pintilie was born on December 9, 1902, in the village of Gudești, Botoșani County, Romania. He came from a peasant family and was the youngest of 11 children. Pintilie's family had strong socialist leanings, and his father was a member of the Social Democratic Party. From an early age, Pintilie was drawn to left-wing politics and became involved in the labor movement.

In 1924, Pintilie was arrested for his involvement in the Romanian Communist Party (RCP), which was banned at the time. He spent several years in prison, where he was subjected to harsh treatment and torture. Despite these conditions, Pintilie continued to advocate for communist ideals and became a respected figure among his fellow inmates.

##Communist rise

Following his release from prison in 1932, Pintilie resumed his activities within the RCP. He quickly rose through the ranks, becoming a key figure in the party's leadership. In 1934, Pintilie was appointed as the secretary of the RCP's Botoșani County committee. He continued to work tirelessly to promote the party's interests and expand its membership.

In 1944, Pintilie was part of the RCP delegation that traveled to Moscow to meet with Soviet leaders. This trip marked a significant turning point in his career, as he established close ties with Soviet officials and received guidance on how to advance the communist cause in Romania.

##DGSP creation

In 1948, Pintilie was appointed as the first chief of the General Directorate for the Security of the People (DGSP), Romania's new secret police agency. The DGSP was modeled after the Soviet Union's KGB and was responsible for suppressing opposition to the communist regime. Pintilie played a key role in shaping the agency's structure and policies, drawing on his experience as a former prisoner and his connections with Soviet officials.

Under Pintilie's leadership, the DGSP quickly became notorious for its brutal tactics and widespread repression. The agency was responsible for arresting, torturing, and executing thousands of people suspected of opposing the communist regime.

##Pushing for atrocities

Pintilie was a strong advocate for the use of force and terror to consolidate communist power in Romania. He believed that the ends justified the means and was willing to do whatever it took to eliminate opposition to the regime. Pintilie's zeal for repression was matched only by his loyalty to the Soviet Union, which he saw as the ultimate authority on communist ideology.

In 1949, Pintilie played a key role in the suppression of the Ţărănism movement, a peasant-led uprising against the communist regime's land reform policies. The DGSP, under Pintilie's leadership, arrested and executed hundreds of suspected Ţărănists, including many innocent civilians.

##Brainwashing experiment

In the early 1950s, Pintilie became involved in a brainwashing experiment designed to break the spirits of suspected enemies of the state. The experiment, known as the "Pitești Experiment," involved subjecting prisoners to physical and psychological torture in an effort to extract confessions and re-educate them in communist ideology.

Pintilie was a strong supporter of the Pitești Experiment and saw it as a key tool in the DGSP's efforts to suppress opposition to the regime. The experiment ultimately failed, but it left a lasting legacy of trauma and repression in Romania.

##In the power struggles

In the mid-1950s, Pintilie became embroiled in a power struggle within the Romanian Communist Party. He was aligned with the faction led by Gheorghe Gheorghiu-Dej, who would eventually become the party's leader. Pintilie's loyalty to Gheorghiu-Dej was rewarded with a promotion to the party's Central Committee.

However, Pintilie's fortunes would eventually decline as he became embroiled in a series of power struggles within the party. In 1956, he was dismissed as chief of the DGSP and replaced by Alexandru Drăghici.

##Political isolation

In the late 1950s, Pintilie found himself increasingly isolated within the Romanian Communist Party. He had fallen out of favor with Gheorghiu-Dej, who had become wary of Pintilie's close ties to the Soviet Union. Pintilie's reputation as a hardliner had also earned him many enemies within the party.

In 1960, Pintilie was expelled from the party's Central Committee and relegated to a minor role in the government. He would spend the remainder of his life in relative obscurity, a shadow of the powerful figure he once was.

##Downfall

Gheorghe Pintilie died on November 21, 1985, at the age of 82. His legacy as a key figure in the establishment of the communist regime in Romania is still widely debated today. While some view him as a ruthless enforcer of repression, others see him as a dedicated servant of the state.

In recent years, Pintilie's role in the Pitești Experiment and other human rights abuses has come under increasing scrutiny. In 2013, the Romanian government officially acknowledged Pintilie's involvement in the experiment and apologized to the victims and their families.

article:
Tornado Outbreak of December 12–15, 2022

A significant tornado outbreak occurred across the southern United States from December 12 to 15, 2022, producing widespread damage and loss of life. The outbreak was characterized by a prolonged period of severe thunderstorms, which spawned numerous tornadoes across multiple states. This article provides an overview of the meteorological conditions that led to the outbreak, the confirmed tornadoes, and the impact of the event.

# Meteorological Synopsis

The tornado outbreak was fueled by a strong low-pressure system that developed over the southern Great Plains on December 12, 2022. The system was driven by a potent short-wave trough that moved eastward from the Rocky Mountains, interacting with a strong frontal boundary that stretched from the Gulf of Mexico to the Ohio Valley. As the system strengthened, it pulled a rich supply of moisture from the Gulf of Mexico, leading to the development of a strong instability axis across the region.

The combination of strong wind shear, instability, and moisture created a highly favorable environment for thunderstorms to develop and intensify. The Storm Prediction Center (SPC) issued a moderate risk (4/5) of severe thunderstorms for parts of the southern United States on December 12, highlighting the potential for long-lived supercells and tornadoes.

# Confirmed Tornadoes

A total of 125 tornadoes were confirmed across seven states during the four-day outbreak, with the majority occurring on December 12 and 13. The tornadoes ranged in intensity from EF0 to EF4, with the most destructive ones occurring in Louisiana and Alabama.

## December 12 Event

The outbreak began on December 12, with a series of tornadoes touching down across eastern Texas and western Louisiana. The first tornado was reported in San Augustine County, Texas, at 2:45 PM CST, causing minor damage and injuring one person. Over the next several hours, multiple tornadoes developed across the region, including a long-lived EF3 tornado that struck DeRidder, Louisiana, killing two people and injuring 20.

## December 13 Event

The most intense tornado activity occurred on December 13, with over 50 tornadoes reported across Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama. The town of Farmerville, Louisiana, was particularly hard hit, with a devastating EF4 tornado killing 12 people and injuring over 100. The tornado caused widespread destruction, leveling entire neighborhoods and leaving thousands without power.

## December 14 Event

Tornado activity decreased significantly on December 14, with only a handful of weak tornadoes reported across the region. However, a strong EF2 tornado did strike the town of Enterprise, Alabama, causing significant damage and injuring several people.

## December 15 Event

The final day of the outbreak saw a resurgence of tornado activity, with over 20 tornadoes reported across Georgia and the Carolinas. The most notable tornado was an EF3 that struck the town of Pembroke, Georgia, killing one person and injuring several others.

## Farmerville, Louisiana

The town of Farmerville, Louisiana, was one of the hardest-hit areas during the outbreak. The EF4 tornado that struck the town on December 13 was one of the most destructive of the outbreak, causing widespread devastation and loss of life. The tornado touched down at 3:45 PM CST, with winds estimated at up to 170 mph. The tornado cut a swath of destruction through the town, leveling entire neighborhoods and leaving thousands without power.

# Non-Tornadic Effects

In addition to the tornadoes, the outbreak also produced significant non-tornadic effects, including damaging winds and large hail. The strong low-pressure system that drove the outbreak produced sustained winds of up to 60 mph, with gusts reaching over 80 mph in some areas. The strong winds caused widespread power outages, with over 100,000 homes and businesses losing electricity at the peak of the outage.

# Impact

The tornado outbreak had a significant impact on the affected regions, with widespread damage and loss of life. The most devastating effects were felt in Louisiana and Alabama, where the majority of the tornadoes occurred. The outbreak caused an estimated $1.5 billion in damages, making it one of the costliest tornado outbreaks in U.S. history.

# See Also

* List of tornado outbreaks
* Tornadoes of 2022
* December 2022 North American winter storm

# Notes

This article is a summary of the tornado outbreak of December 12-15, 2022. For more information on individual tornadoes, please see the relevant articles.

# References

article:
Chandrayaan-3

Chandrayaan-3 is a lunar exploration mission launched by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on July 14, 2023. The mission aims to demonstrate the capability to soft-land a rover on the lunar surface and conduct scientific experiments. Chandrayaan-3 is a significant milestone in India's space program, marking the country's third lunar mission after Chandrayaan-1 and Chandrayaan-2.

# History

The Chandrayaan-3 mission was announced in 2019, with the primary objective of demonstrating the capability to soft-land a rover on the lunar surface. The mission was initially planned to be launched in 2022, but due to technical issues and the COVID-19 pandemic, the launch was delayed several times. The spacecraft was finally launched on July 14, 2023, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota, India.

# Objectives

The primary objective of the Chandrayaan-3 mission is to demonstrate the capability to soft-land a rover on the lunar surface. The mission also aims to:

* Conduct scientific experiments on the lunar surface
* Study the lunar surface composition and geology
* Demonstrate the capability to communicate with Earth from the lunar surface
* Test the performance of the propulsion module and the lander

# Spacecraft

## Design

The Chandrayaan-3 spacecraft consists of three main components: the propulsion module, the Vikram lander, and the Rover Pragyan.

### Propulsion Module

The propulsion module is the main bus of the spacecraft, providing power, communication, and navigation to the lander and the rover. The propulsion module is equipped with a liquid-fueled rocket engine, which provides the necessary thrust for the spacecraft to travel to the Moon and enter into lunar orbit.

### Vikram Lander

The Vikram lander is designed to soft-land on the lunar surface. The lander is equipped with a retro-propulsion system, which provides the necessary thrust to slow down the lander and land safely on the lunar surface. The lander is also equipped with a suite of scientific instruments, including a seismometer, a laser retroreflector, and a radar altimeter.

### Rover Pragyan

The Rover Pragyan is a robotic rover designed to explore the lunar surface. The rover is equipped with a suite of scientific instruments, including an alpha particle X-ray spectrometer, a laser-induced breakdown spectrometer, and a seismic station. The rover is designed to move around on the lunar surface and conduct scientific experiments.

## Payloads

### On Lander

The Vikram lander carries a suite of scientific instruments, including:

* Seismometer: to study the lunar seismic activity
* Laser retroreflector: to measure the lunar surface topography
* Radar altimeter: to study the lunar surface composition and geology

### On Rover

The Rover Pragyan carries a suite of scientific instruments, including:

* Alpha particle X-ray spectrometer: to study the lunar surface composition and geology
* Laser-induced breakdown spectrometer: to study the lunar surface composition and geology
* Seismic station: to study the lunar seismic activity

### On the Propulsion Module

The propulsion module carries a suite of scientific instruments, including:

* High-gain antenna: to communicate with Earth
* Navigation camera: to navigate the spacecraft
* Star tracker: to determine the spacecraft's orientation

# Mission Profile

## Launch

The Chandrayaan-3 spacecraft was launched on July 14, 2023, from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota, India. The spacecraft was launched using the LVM3 (Launch Vehicle Mark 3) rocket, which is a heavy-lift launch vehicle developed by ISRO.

## Orbit

After launch, the spacecraft entered into an elliptical orbit around Earth, with a perigee of 200 km and an apogee of 36,000 km. The spacecraft then performed a series of orbit-raising maneuvers to reach the lunar transfer orbit.

## Landing

The Vikram lander separated from the propulsion module on August 20, 2023, and began its descent to the lunar surface. The lander used its retro-propulsion system to slow down and land safely on the lunar surface.

## Surface Operations

The Rover Pragyan deployed from the Vikram lander on August 20, 2023, and began its exploration of the lunar surface. The rover conducted a series of scientific experiments, including studying the lunar surface composition and geology, and measuring the lunar seismic activity.

## Propulsion Module Reinserted to Orbit around Earth

After the lander and the rover separated from the propulsion module, the propulsion module reinserted itself into orbit around Earth. The propulsion module will continue to orbit Earth, providing communication and navigation services to the lander and the rover.

## Mission Life

The Chandrayaan-3 mission is designed to last for one year, with the lander and the rover operating on the lunar surface for six months. The propulsion module will continue to orbit Earth for several years, providing communication and navigation services to future lunar missions.

# Team

The Chandrayaan-3 mission is led by ISRO, with a team of scientists and engineers from various organizations and institutions. The mission is supported by a number of international partners, including NASA and the European Space Agency.

# Funding

The Chandrayaan-3 mission is funded by the Indian government, with a budget of approximately ₹6 billion (US$80 million).

# Results

The Chandrayaan-3 mission has achieved several significant results, including:

## Temperature Variation

The lander and the rover have measured the temperature variation on the lunar surface, which has helped scientists to understand the lunar surface composition and geology.

## Detection of Sulfur

The rover has detected the presence of sulfur on the lunar surface, which has significant implications for the study of the lunar surface composition and geology.

## Plasma Measurement

The lander and the rover have measured the plasma activity on the lunar surface, which has helped scientists to understand the lunar surface environment.

## Seismic Measurements

The lander and the rover have measured the seismic activity on the lunar surface, which has helped scientists to understand the lunar interior structure and composition.

# Domestic Reactions

The Chandrayaan-3 mission has received widespread attention and acclaim in India, with many hailing it as a significant achievement for the country's space program.

# International Reactions

The Chandrayaan-3 mission has received international attention and acclaim, with many countries congratulating India on its achievement.

# Awards

The Chandrayaan-3 mission has received several awards and accolades, including the 2023 Space Agency of the Year award.

* Chandrayaan-1
* Chandrayaan-2
* Lunar exploration
* Indian Space Research Organisation

article:
Thunivu

Thunivu is a 2023 Indian Tamil-language action thriller film directed by H. Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor under the banner of Bayview Projects LLP and Zee Studios. The film stars Ajith Kumar, Manju Warrier, and Samuthirakani in the lead roles. Thunivu marks the third collaboration between Ajith Kumar and director H. Vinoth after Nerkonda Paarvai and Valimai.

#Plot

Russian forces launched a missile strike on the city of Lviv, hitting a residential building and causing several casualties.

Ukrainian forces recaptured the village of Makiivka in the Luhansk Oblast, marking a significant gain in the region.

article:
2023 Liverpool City Council Election

The 2023 Liverpool City Council election took place on 4 May 2023 to elect members of Liverpool City Council in England. This was on the same day as other local elections across the United Kingdom.

# Candidates

A total of 165 candidates stood for election across the 30 wards of Liverpool City Council, each electing three councillors. The candidates represented a range of political parties, including the Labour Party, Liberal Democrats, Green Party, Conservative Party, and Liberal Party, as well as several independent candidates.

# Council Composition

Prior to the election, the composition of the council was:

* Labour Party: 72 councillors
* Liberal Democrats: 7 councillors
* Green Party: 4 councillors
* Conservative Party: 2 councillors
* Liberal Party: 1 councillor
* Independent: 2 councillors

# Retiring Councillors (Old Wards)

Several councillors chose not to seek re-election in 2023. These included:

* Councillor Richard Kemp (Liberal Democrats), who represented the Church ward
* Councillor Jeremy Wolfson (Labour Party), who represented the Princes Park ward
* Councillor Sarah Jennings (Labour Party), who represented the Riverside ward

# Results Summary

The results of the election saw significant changes to the composition of the council. The Labour Party maintained its majority, but with a reduced number of councillors. The Liberal Democrats and Green Party both made gains, while the Conservative Party lost seats.

# Voter Photo ID

The 2023 Liverpool City Council election was one of the first local elections in the UK to require voters to show photo identification at polling stations. This was part of a trial scheme introduced by the UK government to reduce electoral fraud.

article:
Tartus
================

Tartus is a city located on the Mediterranean coast of Syria, approximately 220 kilometers northwest of Damascus. It is the capital of the Tartus Governorate and has a population of around 550,000 people. The city has a rich history dating back to the Phoenician era and has been an important center of trade, culture, and military significance throughout the centuries.

Etymology
------------

The name "Tartus" is derived from the Phoenician word "Antaradus," which was the name of the city during the Phoenician era. The name "Antaradus" is thought to be derived from the Phoenician words "ant" meaning "face" and "arad" meaning "island." The name was later changed to "Tartus" during the Islamic era.

History
----------

### Phoenician Antaradus

Tartus was founded by the Phoenicians in the 3rd century BC as a trading post. The city was strategically located on the Mediterranean coast and quickly became an important center of trade in the region. The Phoenicians established a strong presence in the city, building temples, markets, and other infrastructure. The city was also an important center of worship for the Phoenician god Baal.

### Greco-Roman and Byzantine era

With the rise of the Roman Empire, Tartus became a Roman colony and was renamed "Antaradus." The city continued to thrive as a center of trade and culture, and the Romans built many new buildings and infrastructure, including a theater, amphitheater, and aqueduct. During the Byzantine era, Tartus was an important center of Christianity, and many churches were built in the city.

### Early Islamic era

In 636 AD, Tartus was conquered by the Arabs and became an important center of Islamic culture and learning. The city was renamed "Tartus" and became a major center of trade and commerce in the region. The Arabs built many new buildings and infrastructure, including mosques, madrasas, and markets.

### Crusades

During the Crusades, Tartus was conquered by the Crusaders in 1124 AD and became a major stronghold of the Kingdom of Jerusalem. The city was renamed "Tortosa" and was an important center of Christian culture and learning. The Crusaders built many new buildings and infrastructure, including churches, castles, and walls.

### Ottoman era

In 1291 AD, Tartus was conquered by the Mamluks and became part of the Mamluk Sultanate. In 1516 AD, the city was conquered by the Ottoman Empire and became a major center of Ottoman culture and learning. The Ottomans built many new buildings and infrastructure, including mosques, madrasas, and markets.

### Modern era

In 1920 AD, Tartus became part of the French Mandate of Syria and was governed by the French until 1946 AD. In 1946 AD, Syria gained independence, and Tartus became an important center of Syrian culture and learning.

Geography
------------

Tartus is located on the Mediterranean coast of Syria, approximately 220 kilometers northwest of Damascus. The city is situated on a small peninsula, surrounded by the Mediterranean Sea to the west and the Syrian coastline to the north, east, and south.

### Climate

Tartus has a Mediterranean climate, characterized by warm summers and mild winters. The city experiences high levels of rainfall during the winter months, with an average annual rainfall of around 900 mm. The summers are hot and dry, with average temperatures ranging from 25°C to 30°C. The winters are mild, with average temperatures ranging from 10°C to 15°C.

Economy
----------

### Industry and navy

Tartus has a strong industrial sector, with many factories and manufacturing plants located in the city. article:
Batang Quiapo (TV series)

Batang Quiapo is a Philippine television drama series that premiered on February 13, 2023, on Kapamilya Channel. The series, which is set in the historic district of Quiapo in Manila, follows the life of a young boy named Tisay who navigates the challenges of growing up in the streets.

#Plot

The series revolves around the life of Tisay, a street-smart and resourceful young boy who lives with his mother, Maita, in the bustling streets of Quiapo. Despite the difficulties they face, Tisay's mother instills in him the value of kindness, compassion, and hard work. As Tisay navigates the ups and downs of life, he meets a cast of characters who become his allies, friends, and sometimes, foes.

Throughout the series, Tisay faces numerous challenges, including poverty, hunger, and the constant threat of danger that lurks in the streets. However, he also experiences moments of joy, love, and triumph, which shape him into the person he is meant to be. As Tisay grows up, he begins to realize his dreams and aspirations, and he learns the importance of family, friendship, and community.

#Cast and characters

##Present

* Coco Martin as Tisay / Tanggol
* Lovi Poe as Maita
* Charo Santos as Lola Tisay
* Cherry Pie Picache as Zeny
* Vina Morales as Marites
* Kiko Estrada as Bong
* Mark Lapid as Odie
* Ronwaldo Martin as Toto

##Former

* Tirso Cruz III as Pilo
* Malou de Guzman as Aling Puring
* Beverly Salviejo as Aling Saling
* Nonie Buencamino as Mang Pepe

#Episodes

The series premiered on February 13, 2023, and has been airing weekdays since then. Each episode is approximately 30 minutes long, including commercials.

#Production

##Development

The series was conceptualized by Coco Martin, who is also the lead actor and executive producer. Martin drew inspiration from his own experiences growing up in the streets of Manila and from the stories of people he met while working on his previous projects. The series is produced by CCM Film Productions, in association with Dreamscape Entertainment.

##Casting

Casting for the series began in late 2022, with Martin being the first to be cast. Lovi Poe and Charo Santos were later announced as part of the main cast. The rest of the cast was announced in the following weeks.

##Filming

Filming for the series began in January 2023 and is ongoing. The series is being shot on location in Quiapo, Manila, as well as in various studios in Metro Manila.

#Broadcast

The series premiered on February 13, 2023, on Kapamilya Channel and is also available to stream on Kapamilya Online Live. The series is also broadcast on A2Z Channel 11 and TV5.

#Soundtrack

The series' soundtrack features original songs performed by various Filipino artists, including Coco Martin, Lovi Poe, and Vina Morales.

#Reception

##Ratings

The series premiered to high ratings, with its pilot episode reaching a peak of 35.4% in the national ratings. The series has maintained its high ratings throughout its run, averaging around 30% in the national ratings.

##Online viewership

The series has also been a hit online, with its episodes garnering millions of views on YouTube and other social media platforms.

##Controversy

###Muslim stereotype controversy

The series has been criticized for its portrayal of Muslim characters, with some viewers accusing the show of perpetuating negative stereotypes. The controversy began when a scene showed a Muslim character wearing a hijab and being portrayed as a villain. The show's producers and writers have since apologized and promised to be more sensitive in their portrayal of Muslim characters.

#Accolades

The series has won several awards, including Best Drama Series at the 2023 PMPC Star Awards for Television.

#Legacy

Batang Quiapo has been praised for its realistic portrayal of life in the streets of Manila and for its positive representation of the Filipino people. The series has also been credited with helping to revive the Philippine television industry.

#Notes

The series is set to run for at least 100 episodes, with the possibility of extension.

* List of Philippine television series
* List of Philippine drama series

2023 Badminton Asia Mixed Team Championships

2022–23 FC Barcelona season

The 2022–23 FC Barcelona season is the club's 123rd season in existence and the 92nd consecutive season in the top flight of Spanish football. In addition to the domestic league, Barcelona are participating in this season's editions of the Copa del Rey, Supercopa de España, UEFA Champions League, and UEFA Europa League.

# Kits

The home kit for the 2022–23 season features a traditional red and blue striped design, with a golden Nike swoosh and a Rakuten logo on the chest. The away kit is a sleek black design with a hint of red, while the third kit is a vibrant orange color. The goalkeepers' kits are in various shades of green.

# Season overview

## Pre-season

Barcelona began their pre-season in July, with a training camp in the United States. The team played several friendly matches against Major League Soccer teams, including Inter Miami and New York Red Bulls. The pre-season campaign concluded with a 6-0 win over Mexican side Pumas UNAM.

## August

The season began on August 13, with a 0-0 draw against Rayo Vallecano in La Liga. Barcelona struggled to create scoring opportunities, but a solid defensive performance earned them a point. The team followed this up with a 4-1 win over Real Sociedad, with Robert Lewandowski scoring his first goal for the club.

## September

September was a mixed month for Barcelona, with a 2-1 loss to Bayern Munich in the Champions League and a 3-0 win over Elche in La Liga. The team also drew 0-0 with Sevilla, in a match that saw Lewandowski miss a penalty.

## October

October saw Barcelona win three consecutive matches, including a 1-0 victory over Inter Milan in the Champions League. The team also beat Villarreal 3-0 and Athletic Bilbao 4-0 in La Liga.

## November

November was a difficult month for Barcelona, with a 3-3 draw against Bayern Munich in the Champions League and a 1-0 loss to Real Madrid in El Clásico. The team also drew 1-1 with Almería in La Liga.

## December

December saw Barcelona win two consecutive matches, including a 2-1 victory over Betis in La Liga. The team also beat Espanyol 4-2 in the Copa del Rey.

## January

January was a successful month for Barcelona, with wins over Atlético Madrid and Girona in La Liga. The team also beat Ceuta 5-0 in the Copa del Rey.

## February

February saw Barcelona win two consecutive matches, including a 2-1 victory over Villarreal in La Liga. The team also beat Real Madrid 1-0 in the Copa del Rey semi-finals.

## March

March was a mixed month for Barcelona, with a 2-1 loss to Real Madrid in the Copa del Rey final and a 2-0 win over Athletic Bilbao in La Liga.

## April

April saw Barcelona win three consecutive matches, including a 1-0 victory over Atlético Madrid in La Liga. The team also beat Getafe 2-1 and Sevilla 3-0 in La Liga.

## May

May was a successful month for Barcelona, with wins over Real Sociedad and Valencia in La Liga. The team also drew 1-1 with Espanyol in La Liga.

## June

The season concluded on June 4, with a 2-0 win over Celta Vigo in La Liga. Barcelona finished second in the league table, with 85 points from 38 matches.
